ygData.subject: Re: Hello
ygData.msgSnippet: You might try the casters realm site to get the details and strategies for your class. I haven t developed this class, so I don t have any background to help.
ygData.messageBody:
You might try the casters realm site to get the details and
strategies for your class. I haven't developed this class, so I don't
have any background to help.

I do know the fear factor. Actually, that is one of the aspects of
this style of gaming that makes playing worthwhile. In console games,
your character and story line are generally created for you. If you
save often enough, trying something dangerous costs you nothing but
the time it takes to learn how to solve the puzzle or beat the boss.

In this game, you invest time and effort to create your character.
You have an investment to protect. I know that I am cautious going
into new situations, not wanting to die and risk losing all that I
have invested. Sometimes the risk is just a corpse run. Sometimes you
can get yourself into a situation where you will need high-level help
to get out, and that help cannot always be found.

The thrill of facing these risks, learning to overcome real danger,
and learning how to capitalize on every new situation is what makes
this game worth playing. You aren't just learning to twitch faster on
your controls. You think, plan, and design your own adventure.

Good hunting to you.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Dawn" <dawn_marie@m...> wrote:
> I am new here, my sister recommended this group to me.
>
> I have a question. I enjoy being an Enchantress because I am
looking
> forward to some of the cool spells that I will eventually get
(Charm,
> KEI, etc.) I just made Level 10 and am scared to death now because
> I'm afraid of getting killed, not being able to get back to my
> corpse, and losing all my stuff.
>
> I joined a website that lists quests and the levels you can
complete
> the quests at, the site says you can complete the Stein of Moggok
> quest at level 8. I have components to make a Stein of Moggok, have
> the book to get another Stein, but when I try to give bartender
Clurg
> the book, his body guard knocks me on my butt. And I can't use the
> Dark Elf Ill. spell until level 12, so why does everyone say that
you
> can finish the quest at 8?
>
> Are there any other quests that low-level Enchantress's can do to
get
> nice equipment, money and experience?
>
> Please help a lady out? Thanks much.
